p: Dengue renal involvement varies from elevated serum creatinine, acute tubular necrosis, hemolytic uremic syndrome, proteinuria, glomerulopathy, nephrotic syndrome, and acute renal injury [ 25]. Despite the remarkable evidence that the transient increase in serum creatinine is linked to increased mortality [ 26], acute renal injury is a poorly studied complication in dengue. The available data indicate the presence of acute renal injury occurs in 0.83% to 14.2% of dengue patients, depending on the methodology and the population evaluated [ 18, 27, 28, 29, 30, 31, 32].
